You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Parameters in Storefront Page URLs

B2B Commerce for Visualforce passes certain information about the current user’s storefront session from page to page using URL parameters. These parameters generally apply only to the activity of a logged-in user, and multiple combinations of parameters can resolve to the same destination page.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Default Parameters

B2B Commerce for Visualforce includes the following parameters in page URLs by default, even if the parameter has no value to pass. These parameters are included for both authenticated and guest users.

NOTE
Search engine bots generally crawl and index the canonical URL to your Home page, Product List page, and Product Detail page. The canonical URL strips out most parameters. However, canonical links aren’t available for all pages, and bots can still crawl non-canonical, parameterized URLs to pages that have canonical URLs defined. Sometimes, those parameters are empty and don’t have a value to pass in the current session.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10), these parameters are included in URLs by default, even if they're empty. To tell Google to ignore one of these parameters in a non-canonical link, use the URL Parameters tool from Google Search Console.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later, these parameters are automatically removed from URLs when they're empty.
cartId
ID of the active shopping cart associated with the current user.
cclcl
User’s default or selected locale.
NOTE
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, this parameter switches to language when a buyer navigates from a Visualforce storefront page to an Experience Builder page.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later, this parameter is included in canonical and alternate language link URLs.
isCSRFlow
Whether a customer service representative (CSR) is managing the current session on behalf of a storefront user.
portalUser
The name of the storefront user that a CSR is managing in a CSR flow.
Context-Specific Parameters

B2B Commerce includes the following parameters in page URLs only when necessary during the current user’s session.

categoryId
ID of a selected category. This parameter applies only when the Product List page shows category results. If you set up friendly URLs, this parameter is hidden.
ccLog
Logging token used for troubleshooting or debugging storefront code execution. This parameter applies only when logging is enabled.
effectiveAccount
ID of the account whose pricing and entitlements are visible when a buyer has selected an effective account. This parameter applies only when effective accounts are enabled.
grid
ID of a price group used for contract pricing. This parameter applies only when you enable contract pricing.
i
ID of a selected invoice. This parameter applies only on the Invoice Detail page.
mnu
Deprecated and no longer used by the managed package.
o
ID of a selected order. This parameter applies only on the Order View page.
pd
ID of a selected payment. This parameter applies only on the Payment Detail page.
selid
ID of a selected seller. This parameter applies only on the Seller Detail page.
sku
SKU of a selected product. This parameter applies only on the Product Detail page. If you set up friendly URLs, this parameter is hidden.
store
The storefront name. This parameter applies only in CSR flow.
